Posts.Content: barcino wrote: Hi Ladies,  First of all my love and support to all of you who are going through cancer or who are worried about it.   I am a 34 year old healthy mother of two.  I have recently lost 50 lbs over the course of 2 years - I have also been breastfeeding two children over the last 7 years.  The last one weaned 5-6 mo ago.  My breasts have gone from huge 36F size to a smaller 34D and I think I might be smaller now and I have lost fat and inches everywhere pretty dramatically.  Lots of inches lost in the chest.   I have noticed a lot of stretchmarks, and loose creppey skin in my breasts and obviously thought nothing about it.  Recently I did a breast exam (which I am awful at keeping up with - not anymore!) and noticed that when I raise my arms there is dimpling/cellulite/ugly skin on the side and under side of both breasts - more pronounced on the right breast.  I am thinking that this is probably related to the weight loss but I am not taking it lightly.  I have my well woman in two weeks so I will point it out to my OBGYN. Is dimpling ALWAYS a sign of bc?  Mine is not one deep dimple - and it is for sure NOT that small dimple orange peel look.  It is like superficial dimples almost ripples and some lines (the lines I think are actually strechmarks) I dont have any other symptoms other than tenderness (but I am about to start my period) and I do still seem to be able to squeeze what I assume is milk from my breasts (both) but I know that can be normal after extended breastfeeding and I nursed for 2.5 years this last one.  I cannot feel any lumps.  Just feels like a lot of fibers in there but I cannot find any lumps. I would love your advice - is my OBGYN the place to start or should I schedule something with a breast specialist or both.   Blessings to all of you and thanks in advance!   I want to walk the line between being smart and proactive and not going over to the freakout zone too quickly because I tend to be really good at that.  If anything this will teach me to take my self examinations very seriously from now on.   Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: breasts dimpling weight loss related or should I be concerned? barcino barcino

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 03:42PM - edited May 25, 2011 03:44PM by barcino lizzy thank you so much - my common sense says what you are saying - loose skin and lack of elasticity and hey if it is that I will jump for joy that all it is is just a little bit of uggly skin ;)  There is some indentations in there but not drastic - kind of a cellulite sad skin type of a look.    Hugs and blessings to you and thank you for your input!  Having just stopped in this community I am awed by each members grace and strenght.  I am going to be praying for you all as a whole. And I will update when I see the OB so if someone else goes wondering the same they can read it.
Posts.Title: breasts dimpling weight loss related or should I be concerned? barcino barcino

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2011 12:00PM barcino wrote: Just wanted to update and say that the OBGYN did an examination and said that both breasts felt totally normal and there was no abnormal tissue.  He said the dimpling is due to the skin changes from weight loss and nothing to worry about :)   Just wanted to update in case anybody else had similar circumstances!   Blessings to all and prayers for those waiting on tests or battling this horrible disease!
Posts.Title: breasts dimpling weight loss related or should I be concerned? barcino barcino

Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 03:31PM barcino wrote: Ooops I had to edit my post - I meant to say it does NOT look like the orange peel smallish dimples.  I corrected it in the above post.
